match.title: 8th Match, Group A
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 7 wickets (with 17 balls remaining)

image.caption: A stunning view of The Oval under lights
image.longCaption: A stunning view of The Oval under lights, England v Australia, 1st ODI, The Oval, September 4, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 13.00 start, First Session 13.00-16.30, Interval 16.30-17.15, Second Session 17.15-20.45

dismissalText.commentary: Jonathan Trott lbw b Herath 76 (87b 5x4 0x6 122m) SR: 87.35

dismissalComment.html: full on the stumps, Trott sweeps and misses and is given out lbw straight away by Billy Bowden, it was too full to sweep really and looked pretty straight. Only things against the call would have been if it was sliding down but I doubt it, caught almost full on the boot

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root c Jayawardene b Malinga 68 (55b 5x4 0x6 74m) SR: 123.63

dismissalComment.html: slower ball on the stumps, 72mph, Root goes to play over the leg side, doesn't get hold of it and finally Sri Lanka hold a catch with Jayawardene clinging on to a simple chance at deep midwicket, bit of a top edge from Root but a fine innings played really well

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: attempts the sweep, playing across the line and hit on the front pad, Dar gives it - but Cook decides to review. Although you could see middle and leg stump this looked in line and Hawk Eye confirms as much, not much turn but it beat the pad and the impact was level with off stump, the decision stands and England's captain is gone, taking their review with him

headshotImage.caption: Jonathan Trott player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jonathan Trott player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: full on the stumps, Trott sweeps and misses and is given out lbw straight away by Billy Bowden, it was too full to sweep really and looked pretty straight. Only things against the call would have been if it was sliding down but I doubt it, caught almost full on the boot

slower ball on the stumps, 72mph, Root goes to play over the leg side, doesn't get hold of it and finally Sri Lanka hold a catch with Jayawardene clinging on to a simple chance at deep midwicket, bit of a top edge from Root but a fine innings played really well

full on the off stump, played forward, a huge cry for lbw and given out! It was pad first but going across Morgan and was it going on to miss off stump? Bowden thought not. Very full and Morgan couldn't get the bat down on it in time

headshotImage.caption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell c Perera b Eranga 20 (37b 3x4 0x6 48m) SR: 54.05

dismissalComment.html: full ball on the stumps and chipped straight to midwicket. A very poor stroke, had the whole of the on side to play into and finds the man, Bell should be very disappointed, it was a poor delivery really, drifting into the pads on a full length to be whipped away but Bell has picked out the fielder

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook lbw b Herath 59 (85b 3x4 0x6 116m) SR: 69.41

dismissalComment.html: attempts the sweep, playing across the line and hit on the front pad, Dar gives it - but Cook decides to review. Although you could see middle and leg stump this looked in line and Hawk Eye confirms as much, not much turn but it beat the pad and the impact was level with off stump, the decision stands and England's captain is gone, taking their review with him

dismissalText.commentary: Jonathan Trott lbw b Herath 76 (87b 5x4 0x6 122m) SR: 87.35

dismissalComment.html: full on the stumps, Trott sweeps and misses and is given out lbw straight away by Billy Bowden, it was too full to sweep really and looked pretty straight. Only things against the call would have been if it was sliding down but I doubt it, caught almost full on the boot

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root c Jayawardene b Malinga 68 (55b 5x4 0x6 74m) SR: 123.63

dismissalComment.html: slower ball on the stumps, 72mph, Root goes to play over the leg side, doesn't get hold of it and finally Sri Lanka hold a catch with Jayawardene clinging on to a simple chance at deep midwicket, bit of a top edge from Root but a fine innings played really well

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan lbw b Malinga 13 (10b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 130

dismissalComment.html: full on the off stump, played forward, a huge cry for lbw and given out! It was pad first but going across Morgan and was it going on to miss off stump? Bowden thought not. Very full and Morgan couldn't get the bat down on it in time

dismissalText.commentary: Jos Buttler c Sangakkara b Kulasekara 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: driven at outside off stump, thin edge and taken by Sangakkara a good low catch going down to his left, Buttler walked and a second ball duck is a second failure in this competition. It wasn't right there to drive and Buttler got a little tickle on it trying to force into the covers

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tim Bresnan b Eranga 4 (7b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: full and straight and cleans Bresnan up as it tries to swing it down the ground and loses his leg stump, just missed a straight one there Bressy. It seemed to be in the slot to drive, Bresnan tried but made no connection

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara not out 134 (135b 12x4 0x6 197m) SR: 99.25
Nuwan Kulasekara not out 58 (38b 5x4 3x6 58m) SR: 152.63

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: goes big *shuts eyes* - oh, he's been caught at mid-on! Perera tried to execute the pick-up off a length over long-on, looked like he'd nailed it but the ball actually came off the toe of the bat and looped rather forlornly to Bopara, who crouched under it for a safe take and England's first wicket

skips across to hooks but only manages to pick out deep square leg! England have the breakthrough they desperately needed, Anderson the bowler, as so often it is! The ball was short and outside the line of off, Jayawardene moved to his right but couldn't keep the shot down, Bairstow plunging forward to take a good catch

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: skip down the wicket and finds long on that is pretty silly you have to say, a thick inside edge, nowhere near enough contact on the stroke and Dilshan is gone. Three cheap overs from England, Dilshan has got frustrated, tried to take Swann into the stands and perished

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Bopara b Anderson 6 (11b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: goes big *shuts eyes* - oh, he's been caught at mid-on! Perera tried to execute the pick-up off a length over long-on, looked like he'd nailed it but the ball actually came off the toe of the bat and looped rather forlornly to Bopara, who crouched under it for a safe take and England's first wicket

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Root b Swann 44 (56b 3x4 1x6 86m) SR: 78.57

dismissalComment.html: skip down the wicket and finds long on that is pretty silly you have to say, a thick inside edge, nowhere near enough contact on the stroke and Dilshan is gone. Three cheap overs from England, Dilshan has got frustrated, tried to take Swann into the stands and perished

headshotImage.caption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c sub (JM Bairstow) b Anderson 42 (43b 3x4 1x6 62m) SR: 97.67

dismissalComment.html: skips across to hooks but only manages to pick out deep square leg! England have the breakthrough they desperately needed, Anderson the bowler, as so often it is! The ball was short and outside the line of off, Jayawardene moved to his right but couldn't keep the shot down, Bairstow plunging forward to take a good catch

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Jonathan Trott player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jonathan Trott player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: Broad replaces Anderson, one to win...

commentTextItems.html: short and on the hips, pulled lazily, sweetly through square leg for four and Sri Lanka win by seven wickets

commentPostTextItems.html: 9.05pm: That's about it from us tonight, folks. A cracking match has "thrown Group A wide open", as I'm contractually obliged to say; Alex and myself will be back to type you through England and New Zealand's not-quite-must-win-but-it's-getting-that-way match on Sunday; there's another game with a fair bit riding on it tomorrow, which will of course be brought to live and non-exclusively. David Hopps' report should be your final stop tonight - thanks for your comments, as ever, tatty-bye!

8.55pm: Mike Atherton has his mike in hand, time for the presentations. England captain, Alastair Cook: "Obviously that was an outstanding hundred, any time you chase 300 someone has to play well. The pitch quickened up but sometimes you have to say credit where it's due. The rate was always seven, we could have taken a couple more wickets but they played well. It was very hard to get the ball to reverse swing and it was changed after 21 overs. I thought 300 was about par - my innings, I couldn't quite get it away, if you add another 20 runs on that would probably have been enough. We knew we'd have to win one of these two game, hopefully we'll come back strongly at Cardiff."

Sri Lanka captain, Angelo Mathews: "We needed that, to be honest, we started confidently and the bowlers were really good in the middle overs, we just had one go for 20 runs near the end. Sanga batted really well, it's great to have a player like that at number three. We had a chat at the break with the batters, thought it might swing and seam a little but the pitch played really well. The management decided [to promote Kula], he's been batting really well and it paid off. The last game we were rusty, in the field missing catches but we can keep improving."

Kumar Sangakkara is named a worthy Man of the Match: "I was pretty happy about it, we had to play well at the start, see off Jimmy Anderson but Mahela played really well and we got on top of it. [Kulasekara's innings] took the pressure off and those two overs, off Swann and Broad, were decisive. That's the Champions Trophy for you, the pressure is on, players aspire to play in it, I'm pleased to have done well today. We've got to win another one, the Aussies are a tough outfit so we'll have to prepare well."

8.45pm: A stunning run chase from Sri Lanka keeps them well and truly alive in the tournament. Beat Australia on Monday and they will be through. England couldn't have been more surprised if Crispian Mills had come out and hammered a decisive half-century at more than a run a ball but, Nuwan Kulasekara's late heroics aside, this was Kumar Sangakkara's match, magisterially seeing his team home with an unbeaten 134. Defeat means England will have to beat New Zealand on Sunday to reach the semi-finals, which is by no means guaranteed. But then, it wouldn't feel right if England weren't in danger of being ejected from their own party, would it?

commentTextItems.html: tip and run into the covers - the scores are tied and Sangakkara will remain on strike to complete the job

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: touch short, sits in the crease and swivel-pulls flat through square leg, it's cut off before the boundary... the champagne remains on ice
full and wide and played out in front of deep extra cover via a flowing flash of the blade
length ball, pushed across from wide on the crease, Sanga made an early move outside off but can only knock it back to the bowler
angled across, stays in the crease and steers towards point

commentPreTextItems.html: Good call, from Hemant Tiwari: "What a brave move from Sri Lankan management; first to play Kulasekara instead of Perera and second to send Kulasekara ahead of a so-called hitter like Mathews...Go Sri Lanka, go!!!!" Yes, no one's missing Thisara now, I guess

commentTextItems.html: pitched up on the stumps, chipped down the ground for a single to long-on
full and on off stump, crunched straight back down the ground to long-on - imperious batting from Sanga

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: picks a gap out towards deep extra cover and they get back for a second
offcutter from Anderson, feet still and swings hard, edged behind but Buttler can only get glove tips on it
slower bouncer, heading down the leg side, Kula ducks it and wide is signalled
angled across and Sanga takes a no-risk single through the covers
pitched up on the stumps, squeezes the ball away through square leg

commentPostTextItems.html: "This pinch hitting knock by Kula reminded me about Upul Chandana's 80 odd against Windies in 2003 while successfully chasing a 300+ score," says Jose Cyriac, with a dreamy look in his eye

commentPreTextItems.html: Back comes Anderson, who'll not admit that the gig is up...

commentTextItems.html: on length, stands talls and chips the ball over mid-on
pitched up on middle and leg, swings hard across the line and clubs one through square

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: very full and straight, gets the yorker in but Kula digs in out
leg-side ball, on a length, flicks the pad and runs through to Buttler

commentPreTextItems.html: Sangakkara's now got the highest score in the tournament so far, by the way

commentTextItems.html: walks forward, cuts into the ground, towards point, they take one
dabs a shortish ball towards point, Sanga again sends the exuberant Kulasekara back

commentPreTextItems.html: Bresnan replaces Swann, who had bowled out. Sri Lanka are coasting home now...

commentTextItems.html: takes an early step across the stumps, drives wide of mid-on, picks a gap and this races away

dismissalComment.html: full and straight and cleans Bresnan up as it tries to swing it down the ground and loses his leg stump, just missed a straight one there Bressy. It seemed to be in the slot to drive, Bresnan tried but made no connection

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Bopara b Anderson 6 (11b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: goes big *shuts eyes* - oh, he's been caught at mid-on! Perera tried to execute the pick-up off a length over long-on, looked like he'd nailed it but the ball actually came off the toe of the bat and looped rather forlornly to Bopara, who crouched under it for a safe take and England's first wicket

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Root b Swann 44 (56b 3x4 1x6 86m) SR: 78.57

dismissalComment.html: skip down the wicket and finds long on that is pretty silly you have to say, a thick inside edge, nowhere near enough contact on the stroke and Dilshan is gone. Three cheap overs from England, Dilshan has got frustrated, tried to take Swann into the stands and perished

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara not out 134 (135b 12x4 0x6 197m) SR: 99.25

headshotImage.caption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c sub (JM Bairstow) b Anderson 42 (43b 3x4 1x6 62m) SR: 97.67

dismissalComment.html: skips across to hooks but only manages to pick out deep square leg! England have the breakthrough they desperately needed, Anderson the bowler, as so often it is! The ball was short and outside the line of off, Jayawardene moved to his right but couldn't keep the shot down, Bairstow plunging forward to take a good catch

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara not out 58 (38b 5x4 3x6 58m) SR: 152.63

seriesStandings.notes:
Points The following points system will apply: Win 2
Tie or no result 1
Loss 0
Group Matches In the event of teams finishing on equal points in its Group, the right to play in the semi-finals will be decided in the following order of priority:
  • The team with the more wins in the Group stage will be placed in the higher position.
  • If there are teams with equal points and equal wins in the Group stage then in such case the team with the higher net run rate in the Group stage will be placed in the higher position (refer below for the calculation of net run rate).
  • If still equal, the team which was the winner of the head to head match played between them will be placed in the higher position.
  • In the highly unlikely event that teams cannot be separated by the above this will be done by drawing lots.
  • If all of the matches within a Group are a no result, the top two seeded teams will progress to the semi-finals.
Semi Final If a semi-final is tied, the teams shall compete in a Super Over to determine which team progresses to the final. Refer Appendix 8 click here to read. If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the Super Over from being completed, or if the match is a no result, then the Group winners shall progress to the Final. Final In the event of a tied Final, the teams shall compete in a Super Over to determine which team is the winner. Refer Appendix 8 click here to read. If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the Super Over from being completed, or if the match is a no result, the teams will be declared joint winners. Net Run Rate A team's net run rate is calculated by deducting from the average runs per over scored by that team throughout the competition, the average runs per over scored against that team throughout the competition. In the event of a team being all out in less than its full quota of overs, the calculation of its net run rate shall be based on the full quota of overs to which it would have been entitled and not on the number of overs in which the team was dismissed. Only those matches where results are achieved will count for the purpose of net run rate calculations. Where a match is abandoned, but a result is achieved under Duckworth/Lewis, for net run rate purposes Team 1 will be accredited with Team 2's Par Score on abandonment off the same number of overs faced by Team 2. Where a match is concluded but with Duckworth/Lewis having been applied at an earlier point in the match, Team 1 will be accredited with 1 run less than the final Target Score for Team 2 off the total number of overs allocated to Team 2 to reach the target. In circumstances where a match (and the points for such match) is awarded to a team as a result of the other team's refusal to play, either by the umpires in accordance with Law 21.3 (a)(ii) or in accordance with the provisions of the relevant event agreements signed by the participating teams, the net run rate of the defaulting team shall be affected in that the full 50 overs of the defaulting team's innings in such forfeited match shall be taken into account in calculating the average runs per over of the defaulting team over the course of the relevant portion of the competition. For the avoidance of doubt the runs scored and overs bowled in such forfeited match will not be taken into account when calculating the net run rate of the team to whom the match was awarded.
